showScoreExcerpt:
I enjoyed all of the performances, the cheesy humor, the intensity of Jennifer Simard’s “Toxic”, and the social commentary on the vagueness of what women are conventionally allowed to want in their personal Prince Charming. The show shines in its acknowledgment of the sexism inherent in fairy tales by making us laugh at it. What some would label “fluff” is socially acceptable in every other genre of media. Theatre can (and should) also hold space for a feel-good, fun night out.
